meanings.definition: To cover or line with paper again.
meanings.sent1: She decided to repapers the walls with colorful wallpaper.
meanings.sent2: After the flood, they had to repapers all the damaged documents.
meanings.sent3: The crafty squirrel tried to repapers its nest with torn newspaper.
meanings.sent4: Her smile repapers the gloomy room with warmth and joy.
meanings.sent5: The artist repapers the canvas with vibrant colors, bringing it to life.

meanings.sent1: The librarian will repapers the shelves with fresh newspapers.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer had to repapers the legal documents before the court hearing.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to repapers their notebooks with clean sheets.
meanings.sent4: The rain repapers the sidewalk with wet leaves, making it slippery.
meanings.sent5: The secretary repapers the files with updated information for the meeting.

meanings.sent1: They decided to repapers the old posters to make them look new.
meanings.sent2: The company will repapers the brochures to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to repapers the torn paper back together.
